title: Job 41:1
text: CANST thou draw out leviathan with an hook?  or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?

title: Job 41:2
text: Canst thou put an hook into his nose?  or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

title: Job 41:3
text: Will he make many supplications unto thee?  will he speak soft words unto thee?

title: Job 41:4
text: Will he make a covenant with thee?  wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

title: Job 41:5
text: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird?  or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

title: Job 41:6
text: Shall the companions make a banquet of him?  shall they part him among the merchants?

title: Job 41:7
text: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed iron?  or his head with fish spears?

title: Job 41:8
text: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

title: Job 41:9
text: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

title: Job 41:10
text: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

title: Job 41:11
text: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him?  whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

title: Job 41:12
text: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

title: Job 41:13
text: Who can discover the face of his garment?  or who can come to him with his double bridle?

title: Job 41:14
text: Who can open the doors of his face?  his teeth are terrible round about.

title: Job 41:15
text: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

title: Job 41:16
text: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

title: Job 41:17
text: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

title: Job 41:18
text: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

title: Job 41:19
text: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.

title: Job 41:20
text: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.

title: Job 41:21
text: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

title: Job 41:22
text: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.

title: Job 41:23
text: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.

title: Job 41:24
text: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.

title: Job 41:25
text: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

title: Job 41:26
text: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.

title: Job 41:27
text: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

title: Job 41:28
text: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

title: Job 41:29
text: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

title: Job 41:30
text: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.

title: Job 41:31
text: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

title: Job 41:32
text: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

title: Job 41:33
text: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.

title: Job 41:34
text: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
